result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Andrew Bangert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark Andrew Bangert is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark Andrew Bangert was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes  DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman DF:  Mark Andrew Bangert appeared. Case called at 8:04. Atty. Chapman updates the court there is an agreement. ADA Nieskes updates the court as to agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 15CM687 without the domestic abuse inhancer. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 15CM687 without the domestic abuse inhancer. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CM687. Sentencing arguments. Victim makes statement. DE makes statement. Crt orders: 
- Costs only
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
   Apply bond on file.   

Court suspends payments until June 1st. Court adjusts a payment plan of $50 a month commencing June 1st.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference at 01-07-2016 09:45 am

Bond on file.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Tamara Doppler.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: CAR for SRN, RPT: Kasten, Clerk: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton for today,  DF:  Mark Andrew Bangert appeared. Defendant does not qualify for PD.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Laurie Bangert  15R 015253. eif
